attributes.action: ensure public funds are not wasted in preparation for the 2014 Commonwealth Games to be hosted in Glasgow.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: In a break from tradition Glasgow is planning to host its Commonwealth Games opening ceremony away from the athletics arena. Rather than upgrading one stadium to host the Commonwealth Games, the successful 2014 bid intends to spend public money upgrading two stadia: Celtic Park (to host the opening ceremony) and Hampden Stadium (to host the main athletics events and also the closing ceremony). This petition calls on the Prime Minister to intervene and prevent this profligacy from occurring by insisting that the opening and closing ceremonies be held at the athletics venue, Hampden Stadium.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
